Description: Small globular vase of marl pottery with small flat base, ledge rim and two cylindrical pierced handles on the shoulder; decorated in faded red-brown paint on each side with a boat with many oars. Wavy lines encircle the neck and are painted above, below and over the handles; below one handle is a fan-like bush motif with a frond emerging out of the top. The base is painted with cross-hatched lines.
Curator's comments: One boat has a double crescent motif (usually interpreted as cow horns) as a standard, the other may be similar but is too worn to be certain. Petrie’s Decorated ware.
Condition: fair - rim and one handle chipped, paint faded
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
